content.description: A lot of fun to do if you want to climb harder while there, top rope hero style.Overhung, with jugs and even crimpy jugs galore. The semi-roof ending is the crux, as it turns over the face the huecos disappear and a few balanced, strong crimps get to the top.
content.protection: Two bolted chains on a quicklink are above the climb. You can TR it by traversing 15 easy feet from September Knights or by rapping 15 feet from another set of bolted anchors approachable by scrambling up the side canyon
content.location: Around the corner from September Knights, up the small side canyon.

content.description: Although short, this may be the most fun and interesting line on CYT.  To establish a TR here, access the top of crag as described in the other route descriptions.  Then cross the dividing crack and do some easy, but exposed, scrambling to the anchors to establish the TR, please use draws.

A really fun line that climbs straight up the face.  The climb is deceiving; where it looks easy, it isn't as easy as it looks. Where it looks hard, it isn't as hard as it looks.  Say no more - we'll ruin the fun.  Get on it and enjoy, the clipping stances are great!  A great place to take pics of folks on CYT or leading this climb or Mark Limage's November Daze just to the west of this line. We really struggled with this being 5.8 or 5.9, please let us know what you think!
content.protection: 8 bolts to a great ledge and chains.
content.location: About 40 feet west of the left edge of CYT.  This climb and November Daze go up the same face.

content.description: Mark put this line up on lead.  It is fun face climbing with numerous holds and great views.
content.location: This line is about 50 feet from the west edge of Cut Your Teeth Crag.  Mike McGlynn and Todd Lane put up a new line about 8 feet right of this route.  It is called September Knights.

content.description: A fun line straight up the face.  This TR can be established either from Interproximal Stripper (to the left), or by ascending the gully further to the left (West) of CYT.  After ascending the gully approximately 40 continue right, up the back side of the main formation.  Then set up a TR on Braces and Bridges and rappel or walk (scary) to these anchors.  Please establish all TR lines with draws.  TRing directly off the chains or rings will wear through the metal quicker then we could drill your bicuspid with a 24v Bosch!

Seven bolts to anchors.  This climb ascends the left-most edge of CYT and can be used to access the chains of Laughing Gas and Braces and Bridges to establish three TR routes.  Just when you think its not 5.7, check your feet - now, rinse and spit.   Youll have to use draws to establish a TR on this one.
content.protection: Seven bolts to anchors.  All hardware is painted black.
content.location: See the attached topo, but this is the left most (west)route on CYT.

content.description: A fun climb bolted for the 5.6 leader.  Some thoughtful moves will get you to the top in no time.  Rappel rings will get you to the ground, but please dont TR on them, use your equalized gear!
A longer and relatively easy climb.  A little bit of everything here-- a small layback at the start, a crack climb in the middle and a small chimney at the top.
content.protection: Two fixed bolts at the base of cut your teeth crag, no chains
content.location: The top rope bolts are located 180 degrees behind the start of Interproximal Stripper.  On your way up to CYT look for the small cave half way up the wall, the route is to the left.  The top of Head Gear is the starting location for all of the CYT climbs.

content.description: A 5.8 start gets easier as you get higher! The main TR line on the crag.  This climb ascends just to the left of the crack that splits CYT in two sections and can be established either from Interpoximal Stripper (with a run-out over easy slab), or by ascending the gully to the left (West) of CYT.  After ascending the gully approximately 40 continue right, up the back side of the main formation.    Rappelling on these anchors provides easy access to Laughing Gas and Interproximal Stripper.     Please TR on draws.

A short, easily protected trad line for the beginning trad leader.   Follow the right-leaning crack to a comfy ledge.  Look down and east on this for some exciting exposure!  Walk off right with one very exposed, but easy move.   Go down a little to an easy walk to the left where you can access the chains on Braces and Bridges or walk off the approach gully - scary.  If set up a TR on this line, please be sure to equalize your anchors!
content.protection: A set of nuts, a couple of medium cams and hexes evenly spaced in this feature get you safely to the top.

content.description: A sunny crag at the saddle between Calico Basin and the Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area.  This crag's belay ledges offer incredible views into the park to the west and the city to the east.  The views from the cliff face are even more spectacular - don't forget to look!  All routes are protected at the top with anchors.  Coupled with a nice Mark Limage route, (November Daze, 5.7, 100') about 50 feet west of Interproximal Stripper, this is an easy place to spend a full day with friends. Enjoy!
